title: Authors and Citation
text: Alan G. Haynes. Author, maintainer. Mattia Branca. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Haynes , Branca M (2024). SwissASR: Automated Completion SwissEthics Annual Safety Report. R package version 0.5.3, https://ctu-bern.github.io/SwissASR/, https://github.com/CTU-Bern/SwissASR.
code: @Manual{,   title = {SwissASR: Automated Completion of the SwissEthics Annual Safety Report},   author = {Alan G. Haynes and Mattia Branca},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.5.3, https://ctu-bern.github.io/SwissASR/},   url = {https://github.com/CTU-Bern/SwissASR}, }

what: Automated Completion of the SwissEthics Annual Safety Report
title: Automated Completion of the SwissEthics Annual Safety Report
text: Participant safety big issue clinical trials reporting safety related events authorities mandatory certain trial types. One aspect annual safety report (ASR) contains summary information listings safety events. SwissASR R package helps compiling report. Provide dataframe given variables function return filled (far possible - things require PI input) ASR MS Word format. forwarded PI supplemental details, signing submission relevant governing bodies.

title: Automated Completion of the SwissEthics Annual Safety Report
text: package can installed CTU Bern’s package universe:

title: Automated Completion of the SwissEthics Annual Safety Report
text: Load usual: main function called asr. lot options, mostly generalizability. dataframe matches default variable names, need use options. Assuming dataframe called sae_data, function used follows IMP. create file called tmp.docx working directory (filename controllable via target option). Default values used parameters, ideal. Changing default settings practice required every study. SwissASR includes RStudio addin skeleton call, including annotations. Use addins menu:  example call might look follows: envisaged script written relatively early trial (first ASR due) relevant fixed data (everything derived database) elements can passed derived database. safety data used compile tables listings. script can run year generate ASR.
code: library(SwissASR) asr(sae_data) asr(data,     target = glue("asr_{sys.Date()}.docx"),     trial_title = "Example trial name",      protocol_number = "1",      basec_number = "sdfsgfdhgfdh",      snctp_number = "sdfhehre",      swissmedic_number = "ergtrjhzt",      ec_name = "KEK Bern",      product_name = "Example product",      sponsor_contact = "Prof. Dr. Example",      inst_name_address = "Example institute, Example street, Example City",      n_centers_t = "10",         # total      - derive from database     n_centers_p = "20",         # planned    - from protocol     n_centers_c = "0",         # closed     - derive from database     n_centers_o = "15",         # open       - derive from database     n_pat_t = "1200",          # target     - from protocol     n_pat_e = "300",           # enrolled   - derive from database     n_pat_c = "111",           # complete   - derive from database     n_pat_p = "10"             # prematurely terminated - derive from database )

what: Fill the Annual Safety Report template — asr
title: Fill the Annual Safety Report template — asr
text: function fills SwissEthics annual safety report template much possible. Minor (formatting) changes still required generation report.

title: Fill the Annual Safety Report template — asr
code: asr(   data,   target = "tmp.docx",   trial_title = "TRIAL NAME",   protocol_number = "default",   basec_number = "default",   snctp_number = "default",   swissmedic_number = "default",   ec_name = "default",   tr_number = "default",   product_name = "default",   sponsor_contact = "default name, default number, default email",   inst_name_address = "default name, default address",   n_centers_t = "default",   n_centers_p = "default",   n_centers_c = "default",   n_centers_o = "default",   n_pat_t = 500,   n_pat_e = 300,   n_pat_c = 100,   n_pat_p = 15,   n_centers_t_ch = "default",   n_centers_p_ch = "default",   n_centers_c_ch = "default",   n_centers_o_ch = "default",   n_pat_t_ch = 500,   n_pat_e_ch = 300,   n_pat_c_ch = 100,   n_pat_p_ch = 15,   n_per_arm = c(grp1 = 150, grp2 = 150),   report_date = format(Sys.Date(), format = "%d/%m/%Y"),   period_from = as.Date("2020-11-02"),   period_to = as.Date("2020-11-17"),   template = system.file("extdata/clino_annual_safety_report_fm.docx", package =     "SwissASR"),   international = FALSE,   trial_type = "imp",   var_class = "class",   var_sae_n = "sae_n",   var_part_id = "record_id",   var_age = "age",   var_sex = "sex",   var_country = "country",   var_site = "site",   var_sae = "sae",   var_date_onset = "sae_date",   var_trt = "trt",   var_date_trt_start = "sae_trtstart",   var_date_trt_stop = "sae_trtstop",   var_outcome = "outcome",   var_comment = "comment",   var_relation = "related",   var_expected = "expected",   var_devdef = "devdef",   var_devdefcouldlead = "devdefcouldlead",   var_devattr = "devattr",   var_devint = "devint",   var_safetymeasure = "safetymeasure",   var_tx = NULL )

title: Fill the Annual Safety Report template — asr
text: data dataframe containing safety data target filename save report trial_title name trial protocol_number trial code/protocol number basec_number BASEC number snctp_number SNCTP number swissmedic_number Swissmedic number ec_name EC name (Lead EC /concerned EC) tr_number Number Transplantation Clinical Trials (FOPH number) product_name product name intervention sponsor_contact contact details sponsor(-investigator) inst_name_address name address institute n_centers_t total number participating centres n_centers_p planned number participating centres n_centers_c number closed centres n_centers_o number open centres n_pat_t target number participants n_pat_e number enrolled participants n_pat_c number completed participants n_pat_p number prematurely terminated participants n_centers_t_ch total number participating centres CH n_centers_p_ch planned number participating centres CH n_centers_c_ch number closed centres CH n_centers_o_ch number open centres CH n_pat_t_ch target number participants CH n_pat_e_ch number enrolled participants CH n_pat_c_ch number completed participants CH n_pat_p_ch number prematurely terminated participants CH n_per_arm number enrolled participants per arm, list group 1 2, define names groups data report_date report date period_from start reporting period period_to end reporting period template path template file international internation national trial (logical) trial_type one imp, medical device, . Abbreviations OK. var_class variable containing SAE class. Options allowed "SAE", "SADR", "SUSAR" var_sae_n variable containing SAE ID var_part_id variable containing participant ID var_age variable containing participant age var_sex variable containing participant sex var_country variable containing participants country var_site variable containing participants site var_sae variable containing SAE type (description) var_date_onset variable containing date SAE occured var_trt variable containing treatment used alleviate SAE var_date_trt_start variable containing date treatment started var_date_trt_stop variable containing date treatment ended var_outcome variable containing outcome SAE var_comment variable containing comment var_relation variable containing relationship randomized intervention var_expected variable saying whether SAE expected var_devdef variable containing whether SAE device deficiency var_devdefcouldlead variable containing whether device deficiency lead SAE var_devattr variable containing whether SAE attributable device var_devint variable containing whether SAE attributable intervention trial var_safetymeasure variable containing whether SAE required safety related measures var_tx variable indicating intervention group. provided, variable included line listing

title: Fill the Annual Safety Report template — asr
text: nothing R, creates docx file target location

title: Fill the Annual Safety Report template — asr
text: Use var_tx argument results indicated variable included line listing.

title: Fill the Annual Safety Report template — asr
code: data(asr_sae) file <- tempfile("asr", fileext = ".docx") asr(asr_sae, file) #> Error in "run(\"osascript\", script_path)": ! System command 'osascript' failed

what: Prepare data for the asr function — asr_dataprep
title: Prepare data for the asr function — asr_dataprep
text: function allows use asr_safety_summary function outside normal asr function, might desirable get overview information different format MS Word.

title: Prepare data for the asr function — asr_dataprep
code: asr_dataprep(   data,   trial_type = "imp",   international = FALSE,   period_from = NA,   period_to = NA,   var_class = "class",   var_sae_n = "sae_n",   var_part_id = "record_id",   var_age = "age",   var_sex = "sex",   var_country = "country",   var_site = "site",   var_sae = "sae",   var_date_onset = "sae_date",   var_trt = "trt",   var_date_trt_start = "sae_trtstart",   var_date_trt_stop = "sae_trtstop",   var_outcome = "outcome",   var_comment = "comment",   var_relation = "related",   var_expected = "expected",   var_devdef = "devdef",   var_devdefcouldlead = "devdefcouldlead",   var_devattr = "devattr",   var_devint = "devint",   var_safetymeasure = "safetymeasure",   var_tx = NULL )

title: Prepare data for the asr function — asr_dataprep
text: data dataframe containing safety data trial_type one imp, medical device, . Abbreviations OK. international internation national trial (logical) period_from start reporting period period_to end reporting period var_class variable containing SAE class. Options allowed "SAE", "SADR", "SUSAR" var_sae_n variable containing SAE ID var_part_id variable containing participant ID var_age variable containing participant age var_sex variable containing participant sex var_country variable containing participants country var_site variable containing participants site var_sae variable containing SAE type (description) var_date_onset variable containing date SAE occured var_trt variable containing treatment used alleviate SAE var_date_trt_start variable containing date treatment started var_date_trt_stop variable containing date treatment ended var_outcome variable containing outcome SAE var_comment variable containing comment var_relation variable containing relationship randomized intervention var_expected variable saying whether SAE expected var_devdef variable containing whether SAE device deficiency var_devdefcouldlead variable containing whether device deficiency lead SAE var_devattr variable containing whether SAE attributable device var_devint variable containing whether SAE attributable intervention trial var_safetymeasure variable containing whether SAE required safety related measures var_tx variable indicating intervention group. provided, variable included line listing

title: Prepare data for the asr function — asr_dataprep
text: list 2 dataframes (data containing data submitted function period_data contains data relevant period) variables renamed expected asr_safety_summary

title: Demonstration data set — asr_sae
text: Simulated recruitment data three sites. row represents SAE. Sites one two started 2020-07-01, site three 2020-09-01.

title: Demonstration data set — asr_sae
text: data frame following variables: sae_date date SAE occured record_id Participant ID age Participant age sex Participant sex country Participant's country site site participant recruited sae Description SAE intervention Intervention arm outcome SAE outcome (e.g. fatal, sequel, improved, resolved) comment comment SAE trt participant treated? class SAE classification (SUSAR, SADR, ...) expected SAE expected devdef (device trials) SAE device deficiency? devdefcouldlead (device trials) whether device deficiency lead SAE devattr (device trials) SAE attributable device? devint (device trials) SAE attributable intervention? safetymeasure (device trials) SAE health hazards required safety-related measures? sae_n SAE number/identifier sae_trtstop SAE treatment stop sae_trtstart SAE treatment start related SAE related intervention

title: Summarize safety data — asr_safety_summary
text: function creates text summary table report.

title: Summarize safety data — asr_safety_summary
text: data SAE data period_data SAE data restricted specific period trial_type trial type (imp, medical device ) n_pat_e Number enrolled participants n_per_arm Number participants enrolled per arm

title: Summarize safety data — asr_safety_summary
text: txt sentences required report tab summary table required report tab_map Mapping variable name tab nicer label

title: Summarize safety data — asr_safety_summary
code: data(asr_sae) # IMP prepped <- asr_dataprep(asr_sae,                         period_from = as.Date("2020-10-10"),                         period_to = as.Date("2021-10-10")                         ) asr_safety_summary(data = prepped$data, period_data = prepped$period_data,                    "imp", 60, n_per_arm = list(grp1 = 150, grp2 = 150)) #> $txt #> [1] "During the reporting period, 20 of 60 participants (33.3 %) reported a total of 20 serious adverse events (SAEs)."                                            #> [2] "9 of 20 SAEs (45.0 %) were classified 'related' to the IMP."                                                                                                  #> [3] "Most frequent related SAEs (i.e., SADR.) documented were poor sleep (3), spontaneous unconsciousness (3), headache (2)."                                      #> [4] "6 Suspected Unexpected Serious Adverse Reactions (SUSARs) occurred during the reporting period, which have been notified to the Swiss competent authorities." #>  #> $txt_all #> [1] "Since the beginning of the study, 20 of 60 participants (33.3 %) reported a total of 20 serious adverse events (SAEs)."                                       #> [2] "9 of 20 SAEs (45.0 %) were classified 'related' to the IMP."                                                                                                  #> [3] "Most frequent related SAEs (i.e., SADR.) documented were poor sleep (3), spontaneous unconsciousness (3), headache (2)."                                      #> [4] "6 Suspected Unexpected Serious Adverse Reactions (SUSARs) occurred during the reporting period, which have been notified to the Swiss competent authorities." #>  #> $tab #> # A tibble: 2 × 5 #>   desc                                                   fatal   sae  sadr susar #>   <chr>                                                  <int> <int> <int> <int> #> 1 Number of cases (during reporting period)                  0    20     5     6 #> 2 Number of cases (cumulative) since the start of the c…     3    17     5     6 #>  #> $tab_map #>   col_key #> 1    desc #> 2   fatal #> 3     sae #> 4    sadr #> 5   susar #>                                                                     name #> 1                                                                    IMP #> 2                       Serious Adverse Events, SAEs, with fatal outcome #> 3                           Other Serious Adverse Events, non-fatal SAEs #> 4                  Serious Adverse Drug Reactions, SADRs (only for IMPs) #> 5 Suspected Unexpected Serious Adverse Reactions, SUSARs (only for IMPs) #>   # medical devices prepped <- asr_dataprep(asr_sae, period_from = as.Date("2020-10-10"),                         period_to = as.Date("2021-10-10"), trial_type = "m") asr_safety_summary(data = prepped$data,                            period_data = prepped$period_data, "m", 60,                             n_per_arm = list(grp1 = NA, grp2 = NA)) #> $txt #>  [1] "During the reporting period, a total of 20 serious adverse events (SAEs) have been reported."                                                                                                                                                    #>  [2] "9 out of 20 SAEs (45.0 %) were classified ''related'' to the MD or to an intervention (procedure) undertaken in the clinical trial."                                                                                                             #>  [3] "In 7 of 20 SAEs (35.0 %) it cannot be excluded that the events are attributable to the medical device under investigation."                                                                                                                      #>  [4] "In 12 of 20 SAEs (60.0 %) it cannot be excluded that the events are attributable to an intervention undertaken in the clinical trial."                                                                                                           #>  [5] "The most frequent SAEs documented were spontaneous unconsciousness (7), headache (5), poor sleep (4)."                                                                                                                                           #>  [6] "Occurrence of SAE in the trial arm versus control arm (if applicable)."                                                                                                                                                                          #>  [7] "With respect to the expectedness of the event, 4 (44.4 %) of the SADEs were expected/anticipated and 5 (144.4 %) were classified as unexpected/unanticipated."                                                                                   #>  [8] "11 device deficiencies were observed (includes malfunctions, use errors, inadequacies in the information supplied by the manufacturer including labelling)."                                                                                     #>  [9] "11 out of 11 device deficiencies (100.0 %) could have led to serious adverse events if suitable action had not been taken, intervention had not been made, or circumstances had been less fortunate (device deficiencies with a SAE potential)." #> [10] "12 health hazards that required safety-related measures occurred."                                                                                                                                                                               #> [11] "Safety and protective measures taken by the investigator/sponsor (including those requested by the ethics committee and Swissmedic and authorities abroad) taken in Switzerland and abroad: [free text]"                                         #>  #> $txt_all #>  [1] "During the reporting period, a total of 20 serious adverse events (SAEs) have been reported."                                                                                                                                                    #>  [2] "9 out of 20 SAEs (45.0 %) were classified ''related'' to the MD or to an intervention (procedure) undertaken in the clinical trial."                                                                                                             #>  [3] "In 7 of 20 SAEs (35.0 %) it cannot be excluded that the events are attributable to the medical device under investigation."                                                                                                                      #>  [4] "In 12 of 20 SAEs (60.0 %) it cannot be excluded that the events are attributable to an intervention undertaken in the clinical trial."                                                                                                           #>  [5] "The most frequent SAEs documented were spontaneous unconsciousness (7), headache (5), poor sleep (4)."                                                                                                                                           #>  [6] "Occurrence of SAE in the trial arm versus control arm (if applicable)."                                                                                                                                                                          #>  [7] "With respect to the expectedness of the event, 4 (44.4 %) of the SADEs were expected/anticipated and 5 (144.4 %) were classified as unexpected/unanticipated."                                                                                   #>  [8] "11 device deficiencies were observed (includes malfunctions, use errors, inadequacies in the information supplied by the manufacturer including labelling)."                                                                                     #>  [9] "11 out of 11 device deficiencies (100.0 %) could have led to serious adverse events if suitable action had not been taken, intervention had not been made, or circumstances had been less fortunate (device deficiencies with a SAE potential)." #> [10] "12 health hazards that required safety-related measures occurred."                                                                                                                                                                               #> [11] "Safety and protective measures taken by the investigator/sponsor (including those requested by the ethics committee and Swissmedic and authorities abroad) taken in Switzerland and abroad: [free text]"                                         #>  #> $tab #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   desc                                                       sade  attr measures #>   <chr>                                                     <int> <int>    <int> #> 1 Number of cases (during reporting period) Device Effects SADE #> 3 Device Deficiencies that could have led to an SAE (serious deficiencies) #> 4          Safety and protective measures taken in Switzerland and abroad. #>   # other trial asr_safety_summary(data = prepped$data, period_data = prepped$period_data, "o", 60,  n_per_arm = list(grp1 = 150, grp2 = 150)) #> $txt #> [1] "During the reporting period, 20 of 60 participants (33.3 %) reported a total of 20 serious adverse events (SAEs) with possible relationship to the study intervention)." #> [2] "The most frequent documented SAEs with possible relationship to the intervention were poor sleep (3), spontaneous unconsciousness (3), headache (2)."                    #>  #> $txt_all #> [1] "Since the beginning of the study, 20 of 60 participants (33.3 %) reported a total of 20 serious adverse events (SAEs) with possible relationship to the study intervention)." #> [2] "The most frequent documented SAEs with possible relationship to the intervention were poor sleep (3), spontaneous unconsciousness (3), headache (2)."                         #>  #> $tab #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   desc                                                              fatal nfatal #>   <chr> start of the clinical tri…     1      8 #>  #> $tab_map #>   col_key #> 1    desc #> 2   fatal #> 3     sae #>                                                                               name #> 1 a causality to the intervention cannot be excluded #>   # tpr trial asr_safety_summary(data = prepped$data, period_data = prepped$period_data, "t", 60,  n_per_arm = list(grp1 = 150, grp2 = 150)) #> $txt #> [1] "During the reporting period, a total of 20 Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) occurred." administration and preparation procedures of TrP/GT/GMO, etc." #> [6] "6 Suspected Unexpected Serious Adverse Reactions (SUSARs) occurred during the reporting period." headache (5), poor sleep (4)."                                                                                                    #> [4] "In 3 out of 5 SADRs (60.0 %) it cannot be excluded that the that the events are attributable to other factors like quality defects, contaminations, administration and preparation procedures of TrP/GT/GMO, etc." #> [6] "6 Suspected Unexpected Serious Adverse cases (during reporting period)           0     20     0     5     6 #> 2 Number of cases (cumulative) since the start o…     3     17     0     5     6 #>  #> $tab_map #>   col_key title: SwissASR 0.5.3
text: Last updates align latest template add warning special characters causing problem producing Word report R.

title: SwissASR 0.5.2
text: Correction template inputs, dates formatting additional note SAEs tables.

title: SwissASR 0.5.1
text: Corrected version word template, 2.1 instead 1.1.

title: SwissASR 0.5.0
text: Modified template ASR align newest template available swissethics website. Main changes: update text parts template inclusion transplant typology trial. Addition RStudio add-pastes template asr call active R script. RStudio, put cursor desired file, click “Addins” “Add asr call template” template appear. Using guiding text, edit arguments appropriate.

title: SwissASR 0.4.0
text: Modified bookmarks word fields replacement can still happen tables , per recent update officer package. resolves issue #9. change requires use doconv package, may require setting permissions MAC OS (details see doconv documentation), may work Ubuntu systems.

title: SwissASR 0.3.0
text: Additional option include intervention (random allocation) variable line listing (option var_tx), sometimes requested ethics bodies. Addition logo

title: SwissASR 0.2.0
text: Addition asr_dataprep asr_safety_summary functions allowing production tables without generation MS Word report. Reworking internals asr utilise mentioned functions. Addition demonstration dataset. Line listing pages word template set landscape.

title: SwissASR 0.1.0
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
